{"abstract": "In the eat-or-be-eaten world of banking, Greater Bay Bancorp\u2018s network of Bay Area community banks became a snack Friday for giant Wells Fargo. {"abstract": "When it comes to corporate philanthropy, Minneapolis-St. Paul is a bastion of giving in an age when most companies are cutting back.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/22/business/22nocera.html", "snippet": "When it comes to corporate philanthropy, Minneapolis-St. Paul is a bastion of giving in an age when most companies are cutting back.", "lead_paragraph": "My philanthropic tour of Minneapolis began on the banks of the Mississippi River, where the Great Northern Railroad once transported flour from the giant mills of General Mills and Pillsbury. {"abstract": "Wells Fargo said its earnings rose in part because it was more cautious with mortgage lending and less willing to engage in volatile Wall Street trading.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/21/business/21bank.html", "snippet": "Wells Fargo said its earnings rose in part because it was more cautious with mortgage lending and less willing to engage in volatile Wall Street trading.", "lead_paragraph": "SAN FRANCISCO \u0097 Within weeks of scooping up the failed banking operations of Washington Mutual in late 2008, JPMorgan Chase began phasing out the WaMu brand, replacing signs on retail branches. gains in the job market.", "lead_paragraph": "FEAR dominated many headlines in the fourth quarter, as unemployment in the United States, a debt crisis in Europe and inflation in China nagged at {"abstract": "Wells Fargo mostly has resisted the call to put down stakes on Wall Street, but it\u2019s easy to see the allure.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2011/10/11/business/big-temptations-for-wells-fargo.html", "snippet": "Wells Fargo mostly has resisted the call to put down stakes on Wall Street, but it\u2019s easy to see the allure.", "lead_paragraph": "Will Wells Fargo get hooked on Wall Street? {"abstract": "Talks fall apart on a merger of EADS and BAE Systems. | A Wall Street job is \u201cgood work if you can get it,\u201d New York State\u2019s comptroller says. | In a new lawsuit, United States prosecutors are claiming Wells Fargo deceived the federal government about the quality of mortgages. | The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is resisting Wall Street\u2019s efforts to temper Dodd-Frank.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2012/10/10/aerospace-deal-talks-collapse/", "snippet": "Talks fall apart on a merger of EADS and BAE Systems. | A Wall Street job is \u201cgood work if you can get it,\u201d New York State\u2019s comptroller says. | In a new lawsuit, United States prosecutors are claiming Wells Fargo deceived the federal government a...", "lead_paragraph": "AEROSPACE DEAL TALKS COLLAPSE \u00a0|\u00a0 Talks between the aerospace giants EADS and BAE Systems have fallen apart. {"abstract": "District court judges are not generally known as flamethrowers, but some seem to be losing patience with banks in cases involving lending practices.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/09/29/business/why-judges-are-scowling-at-banks.html", "snippet": "District court judges are not generally known as flamethrowers, but some seem to be losing patience with banks in cases involving lending practices.", "lead_paragraph": "LAST week, for the first time since the financial crisis, the government faced off in court against a major bank over lending practices during the mortgage mania. Lawyers for the Justice Department contend that Countrywide Financial, a unit of Bank of America, misrepresented the quality of mortgages it sold to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the taxpayer-owned mortgage finance giants, starting in 2007. Fannie and Freddie incurred gross losses of $850 million on the defective loans and net losses of $131 million, the government said.", "print_section": "BU", "print_page": "1", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Why Judges Are Scowling at Banks", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Why Judges Are Scowling at Banks", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Mortgages", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Morgenson, Gretchen", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Courts and the Judiciary", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Foreclosures", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Banking and Financial Institutions", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Countrywide Financial Corp", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Bank of America Corporation", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Wells Fargo & Company", "rank": 8, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Suits and Litigation (Civil)", "rank": 9, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Young, William G", "rank": 10, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Drain, Robert D", "rank": 11, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2013-09-28T18:21:12+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "SundayBusiness", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Gretchen Morgenson", "person": [{"firstname": "Gretchen", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Morgenson", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/d8846db3-79e6-5bc1-947a-51745ebcaa36", "word_count": 1122, "uri": "nyt://article/d8846db3-79e6-5bc1-947a-51745ebcaa36"}

{"abstract": "Sponsorship spending for cause marketing is expected to total $1.78 billion this year, up almost 5 percent over last year.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/09/30/business/media/accounts-and-people-of-note-in-the-advertising-industry.html", "snippet": "Sponsorship spending for cause marketing is expected to total $1.78 billion this year, up almost 5 percent over last year.", "lead_paragraph": "Sponsorship spending for cause marketing is expected to total $1.78 billion this year, according to IEG, Chicago, up 4.8 percent from $1.7 billion last year. By comparison, spending last year rose only 1.2 percent from 2011. The most active companies sponsoring causes \u2013 as determined by the percentage of causes reporting the companies as sponsors \u2013 are Bank of America, 18 percent; Coca-Cola, 14 percent; and three tied at 13 percent: Wells Fargo, Johnson & Johnson and Wal-Mart Stores.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry", "kicker": "Webdenda", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "ADVERTISING AND MARKETING", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Hiring and Promotion", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Public Relations and Publicity", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Appointments and Executive Changes", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2013-09-30T13:32:10+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "Media", "byline": {"original": "By The New York Times", "person": [], "organization": "The New York Times"}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/38906395-26b5-57d1-ad53-3b0dbb65ea9d", "word_count": 742, "uri": "nyt://article/38906395-26b5-57d1-ad53-3b0dbb65ea9d"}

{"abstract": "The European Parliament weighs how to regulate electronic cigarettes, while JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo kick off Wall Street\u2019s third-quarter earnings season on Friday.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2013/10/07/business/economic-reports-for-the-week-ahead.html", "snippet": "The European Parliament weighs how to regulate electronic cigarettes, while JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo kick off Wall Street\u2019s third-quarter earnings season on Friday.", "lead_paragraph": "E-CIGARETTES The European Parliament, meeting in Strasbourg, France, plans to vote on Tuesday on a broad set of proposed tobacco regulations \u2014 the most contentious of which is how to regulate electronic cigarettes. Advocates of e-cigarettes say they are less harmful than conventional cigarettes, because users inhale nicotine-infused vapors instead of smoke. Despite the products\u2019 growing popularity, some European public health officials want them regulated as medical devices. Even if tobacco industry lobbyists prevail in getting the European Parliament to back a less stringent form of regulation, the vote would be only a step in a European rule-making process for e-cigarettes that could continue into next year or beyond. ", "print_section": "B", "print_page": "2", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Economic Reports for the Week Ahead", "kicker": null, "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "Economic Reports for the Week Ahead", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Banking and Financial Institutions", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Regulation and Deregulation of Industry", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "United States Economy", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2013-10-06T22:27:19+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "", "person": [], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "List", "_id": "nyt://article/1b6f8372-c55c-5003-b898-2843edd68c9b", "word_count": 441, "uri": "nyt://article/1b6f8372-c55c-5003-b898-2843edd68c9b"}

{"abstract": "JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo, set to report fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, will kick off a flurry of bank earnings, and Intel will post its fourth-quarter results.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/13/business/economic-reports-for-the-week-of-jan-13.html", "snippet": "JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo, set to report fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, will kick off a flurry of bank earnings, and Intel will post its fourth-quarter results.", "lead_paragraph": "BANK EARNINGS JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo, set to report fourth-quarter results on Tuesday, will kick off a flurry of bank earnings. The banking giants, analysts say, will most likely face sluggish demand from borrowers whose appetite for refinancing has been sapped by rising rates. For JPMorgan Chase, the nation\u2019s largest bank, the quarterly report comes after a string of costly government settlements, prompting analysts to predict that high legal costs could hamper profit. All told, JPMorgan will have paid some $20 billion to resolve government investigations in the last 12 months alone. {"abstract": "Doctor at SAC insider trading trial says trader knew so much detail about a drug trial, it was like \u201che was in the room.\u201d | Goldman Sachs reports earnings after strong results from Bank of America and Wells Fargo. | Yahoo fires its No. 2 executive. | Let\u2019s play the M.&A. Ross took the witness stand for a second day at the insider trading trial of Mathew Martoma, a former hedge fund manager at SAC Capital Advisors. {"abstract": "The proposed regulation could require JPMorgan Chase, one of the eight large banks targeted, to come up with an additional $20 billion in capital.", "web_url": {"abstract": "While worth only about $10,000, the gold nuggets have sentimental value to the large bank, which was founded during the gold rush of the 19th century.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2015/01/27/historic-gold-nuggets-stolen-from-wells-fargo-museum/", "snippet": "While worth only about $10,000, the gold nuggets have sentimental value to the large bank, which was founded during the gold rush of the 19th century.", "lead_paragraph": "Three masked robbers smashed a stolen sport utility vehicle into the entrance of Wells Fargo\u2019s corporate museum in {"abstract": "Yahoo plans to spin off its stake in Alibaba. | The outcome of the fight over DuPont could define shareholder activism. | U.S. strengths are hurting American multinational corporations. | Thieves steal gold nuggets from Wells Fargo museum.", "web_url": "https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2015/01/28/morning-agenda-yahoos-alibaba-split/", "snippet": "Yahoo plans to spin off its stake in Alibaba. | The outcome of the fight over DuPont could define shareholder activism. | U.S. strengths are hurting American multinational corporations. | Thieves steal gold nuggets from Wells Fargo museum.", "lead_paragraph": "Marissa Mayer, the chief executive of Yahoo, said on Tuesday that the Internet company would spin off its 15.4 percent stake in Alibaba, China\u2019s leading e-commerce company, into a separate company, Vindu Goel and Michael J. de la Merced report in The New York Times. Shareholders will directly reap all the remaining profit from Yahoo\u2019s investment, which cost almost nothing a decade ago but is now worth about $39.5 billion. The Alibaba stake alone now makes up nearly 85 percent of Yahoo\u2019s market value. Shares of Yahoo rose about 7 percent in after-hours trading after disclosure of the plan.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Morning Agenda: Yahoo\u2019s Alibaba Split", "kicker": "DealBook", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [], "pub_date": "2015-01-28T12:34:42+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "byline": {"original": "By Sydney Ember", "person": [{"firstname": "Sydney", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Ember", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/1c5a5d61-75f5-5bec-a775-9dbbaaa8c0a7", "word_count": 1982, "uri": "nyt://article/1c5a5d61-75f5-5bec-a775-9dbbaaa8c0a7"}

{"abstract": "Cutting costs and eliminating huge legal bills have helped the bank, but its rivals are ahead on efficiency, among other areas.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/15/business/dealbook/bank-of-americas-hunt-for-growth.html", "snippet": "Cutting costs and eliminating huge legal bills have helped the bank, but its rivals are ahead on efficiency, among other areas.", "lead_paragraph": "Wells Fargo and JPMorgan have reported third-quarter results that highlight a $7 billion challenge for rival Bank of America. That\u2019s the extra annual profit the lender run by Brian Moynihan would need to earn for a 10 percent return on equity, generally the level at which big banks cover their cost of capital. Cutting spending to match Wells Fargo\u2019s efficient operation would not quite suffice, though. And JPMorgan proved on Tuesday that it can manage passable results even when revenue falls.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Bank of America\u2019s Hunt for Growth", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "organizations", "value": "Bank of America Corporation", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "JPMorgan Chase & Company", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Wells Fargo & Company", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Banking and Financial Institutions", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Moynihan, Brian T", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}, {"name": "persons", "value": "Dimon, James", "rank": 6, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Company Reports", "rank": 7, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2015-10-15T01:55:57+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Antony Currie", "person": [{"firstname": "Antony", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Currie", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/3073b9ef-3f52-579d-82ce-c0def54c8a0c", "word_count": 399, "uri": "nyt://article/3073b9ef-3f52-579d-82ce-c0def54c8a0c"}

{"abstract": "In long letters this week, two regulators pointed to the dangers created by the global reach and complexity of the largest banks, which are bigger now than they were before the 2008 crisis.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/14/business/dealbook/living-wills-of-5-banks-fail-to-pass-muster.html", "snippet": "In long letters this week, two regulators pointed to the "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/16/business/dealbook/wells-fargo-scandal-offers-a-chance-to-punish-big-bank-executives.html", "snippet": "Prosecutors and regulators have often struggled to find definitively who is at fault for misdeeds at big banks, while more easily penalizing small lenders.", "lead_paragraph": "The Wells Fargo scandal puts size to a fresh regulatory test. Despite a settlement, the authorities aren\u2019t finished with the bank\u2019s fake-accounts scandal. Top executives at small lenders have been punished harshly in the past for misdeeds. If Wells Fargo executives escape any such fate, it could escalate tension over the accountability divide.", "source": "The New York Times", "multimedia": [], "headline": {"main": "Wells Fargo Scandal Offers a Chance to Punish Big Bank Executives", "kicker": "Breakingviews", "content_kicker": null, "print_headline": "", "name": null, "seo": null, "sub": null}, "keywords": [{"name": "subject", "value": "Banking and Financial Institutions", "rank": 1, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Regulation and Deregulation of Industry", "rank": 2, "major": "N"}, {"name": "subject", "value": "Fines (Penalties)", "rank": 3, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Office of the Comptroller of the Currency", "rank": 4, "major": "N"}, {"name": "organizations", "value": "Wells Fargo & Company", "rank": 5, "major": "N"}], "pub_date": "2016-09-15T19:32:21+0000", "document_type": "article", "news_desk": "Business", "section_name": "Business Day", "subsection_name": "DealBook", "byline": {"original": "By Gina Chon", "person": [{"firstname": "Gina", "middlename": null, "lastname": "Chon", "qualifier": null, "title": null, "role": "reported", "organization": "", "rank": 1}], "organization": null}, "type_of_material": "News", "_id": "nyt://article/720f4dd2-917f-56a0-a121-88a6f159c7ce", "word_count": 356, "uri": "nyt://article/720f4dd2-917f-56a0-a121-88a6f159c7ce"}]

[{"abstract": "Under fire for a scandal in which employees set up sham accounts, the bank solidified its leadership structure under the chairman\u2019s heir-apparent.", "web_url": "https://www.nytimes.com/2016/10/11/business/dealbook/wells-fargo-reshuffles-top-ranks-rallying-around-its-no-2.html", "snippet": "Under fire for a scandal in which employees set up sham accounts, the bank solidified its leadership structure under the chairman\u2019s heir-apparent.", "lead_paragraph": "Wells Fargo, under fire from all sides because of a long-running scandal in which employees set up illegal accounts to meet sales quotas, announced a restructuring of its top management on Monday, solidifying the leadership structure beneath Timothy J.
